describe: Benin is a West African nation known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and diverse landscapes. It is the birthplace of the Vodun (Voodoo) religion and home to the former Dahomey Kingdom. The country features a mix of coastal plains, mountains, and savannas.

cities.name: üèù Cotonou
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southern coast of Benin, along the Gulf of Guinea.
cities.climate: Cotonou has a tropical wet and dry climate with a long wet season from April to July and a short wet season from September to November.
cities.famous_cuisine: Famous local dishes include Akpan, a fermented maize dish, and Yovo Doko, a type of fried dough.

cities.name: üèù Porto-Novo
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southeastern part of Benin, near the Nigerian border.
cities.climate: Porto-Novo experiences a tropical savanna climate with distinct wet and dry seasons.
cities.famous_cuisine: Known for dishes like Kuli-Kuli, a spicy peanut snack, and Acaraj√©, a deep-fried ball of black-eyed pea dough.

cities.name: üèù Ouidah
cities.geographical_location: Located on the Atlantic coast, west of Cotonou.
cities.climate: Ouidah has a tropical climate with a long rainy season and high humidity.
cities.famous_cuisine: Popular dishes include Grilled Fish with spicy sauce and Ablo, a steamed corn cake.
